texts.label: list_item
texts.orig: 1. (1) This Act applies to:
texts.text: (1) This Act applies to:

texts.label: section_header
texts.orig: Domain Name Registry
texts.text: Domain Name Registry

texts.label: section_header
texts.orig: Establishment of the Domain Name Registry
texts.text: Establishment of the Domain Name Registry

texts.label: list_item
texts.orig: 2. (1) There is established by this Act the Ghana Domain Name Registry.
texts.text: (1) There is established by this Act the Ghana Domain Name Registry.

texts.label: list_item
texts.orig: (2)  The Registry is a body corporate with perpetual succession and a common seal and may sue and be sued in its corporate name.
texts.text: The Registry is a body corporate with perpetual succession and a common seal and may sue and be sued in its corporate name.

texts.label: list_item
texts.orig: (3)  The Registry is a non-profit making entity.
texts.text: The Registry is a non-profit making entity.

texts.label: section_header
texts.orig: Duties of the Registry
texts.text: Duties of the Registry

texts.label: list_item
texts.orig: 3. (1) The Registry shall enhance public awareness on the economic and commercial benefits of domain name registration.
texts.text: (1) The Registry shall enhance public awareness on the economic and commercial benefits of domain name registration.

texts.label: list_item
texts.orig: (2)  The Registry:
texts.text: The Registry:

texts.label: list_item
texts.orig: (a) may  conduct  investigations  related  to  its  functions  that  it  considers necessary;
texts.text: (a) may  conduct  investigations  related  to  its  functions  that  it  considers necessary;

texts.label: list_item
texts.orig: (b) shall  conduct  research  into  and  keep  abreast  with  developments  in  the country and elsewhere on the domain name system;
texts.text: (b) shall  conduct  research  into  and  keep  abreast  with  developments  in  the country and elsewhere on the domain name system;

texts.label: list_item
texts.orig: (c) shall continually survey and evaluate the extent to which the .gh domain name space meets the needs of the citizens;
texts.text: (c) shall continually survey and evaluate the extent to which the .gh domain name space meets the needs of the citizens;

texts.label: list_item
texts.orig: (d) may issue information on the registration of domain names in the country;
texts.text: (d) may issue information on the registration of domain names in the country;

texts.label: list_item
texts.orig: (e) shall conduct biennial audits on all licensed registrars; and
texts.text: (e) shall conduct biennial audits on all licensed registrars; and

texts.label: list_item
texts.orig: (f) shall uphold fundamental human rights in the performance of its functions.
texts.text: (f) shall uphold fundamental human rights in the performance of its functions.

texts.label: list_item
texts.orig: (3)  The Registry may, and shall when requested by the Minister, make recommendations to the Minister in relation to policy concerned with the .gh domain name space.
texts.text: The Registry may, and shall when requested by the Minister, make recommendations to the Minister in relation to policy concerned with the .gh domain name space.

texts.label: list_item
texts.orig: (4)  The Registry shall continually evaluate the effectiveness of this Act and action taken towards the management of the .gh domain name space.
texts.text: The Registry shall continually evaluate the effectiveness of this Act and action taken towards the management of the .gh domain name space.

texts.label: list_item
texts.orig: (5)  The Registry may:
texts.text: The Registry may:

texts.label: list_item
texts.orig: (a) liaise, consult and co-operate with any person or other Registry; and
texts.text: (a) liaise, consult and co-operate with any person or other Registry; and

texts.label: list_item
texts.orig: (b) appoint experts and other consultants on conditions that the Registry may determine.
texts.text: (b) appoint experts and other consultants on conditions that the Registry may determine.

texts.label: section_header
texts.orig: Functions of the Registry
texts.text: Functions of the Registry

texts.label: list_item
texts.orig: 4. (1) The Registry is responsible for the .gh domain name space and shall:
texts.text: (1) The Registry is responsible for the .gh domain name space and shall:

texts.label: list_item
texts.orig: (a) be  the  only  domain name  Registry and  operate  the  only  registry  of  .gh domain names;
texts.text: (a) be  the  only  domain name  Registry and  operate  the  only  registry  of  .gh domain names;

texts.label: list_item
texts.orig: (b) administer and manage the .gh domain name space;
texts.text: (b) administer and manage the .gh domain name space;

texts.label: list_item
texts.orig: (c) comply  with  international  best  practice  in  the  administration  of  the  .gh domain name space;
texts.text: (c) comply  with  international  best  practice  in  the  administration  of  the  .gh domain name space;

texts.label: list_item
texts.orig: (d) update  and  maintain  the  central  registry  and  perform  any  function necessary to ensure the proper functioning of the .gh domain name space;
texts.text: (d) update  and  maintain  the  central  registry  and  perform  any  function necessary to ensure the proper functioning of the .gh domain name space;

texts.label: list_item
texts.orig: (e) implement Domain Name System Security Extensions for all .gh domain names;
texts.text: (e) implement Domain Name System Security Extensions for all .gh domain names;

texts.label: list_item
texts.orig: (f) license and regulate registrars;
texts.text: (f) license and regulate registrars;

texts.label: list_item
texts.orig: (g) provide  secure  email  hosting  services  with  end-to-end  encryption  for metropolitan,  municipal  and  district  assemblies,  government  ministries, agencies and departments, and security agencies;
texts.text: (g) provide  secure  email  hosting  services  with  end-to-end  encryption  for metropolitan,  municipal  and  district  assemblies,  government  ministries, agencies and departments, and security agencies;

texts.label: list_item
texts.orig: (h) publish guidelines on:
texts.text: (h) publish guidelines on:

texts.label: list_item
texts.orig: (i) the  general  administration  and  management  of  the  .gh  domain name space;
texts.text: (i) the  general  administration  and  management  of  the  .gh  domain name space;

texts.label: list_item
texts.orig: (ii)  web standards for metropolitan, municipal and district assemblies, government  ministries,  agencies  and  departments,  and  security agencies;
texts.text: (ii)  web standards for metropolitan, municipal and district assemblies, government  ministries,  agencies  and  departments,  and  security agencies;

texts.label: list_item
texts.orig: (iii) the requirements and procedures for domain name registration; and
texts.text: (iii) the requirements and procedures for domain name registration; and

texts.label: list_item
texts.orig: (iv) the maintenance of and public access to the repository, with due regard to the policy directives which the Minister may give from time to time; and
texts.text: (iv) the maintenance of and public access to the repository, with due regard to the policy directives which the Minister may give from time to time; and

texts.label: list_item
texts.orig: (i) audit metropolitan, municipal and district assemblies, government ministries',  agencies',  and  departments',  and  security  agencies'  web applications at a prescribed fee.
texts.text: (i) audit metropolitan, municipal and district assemblies, government ministries',  agencies',  and  departments',  and  security  agencies'  web applications at a prescribed fee.

texts.label: list_item
texts.orig: (2)  After the assumption of responsibility for the .gh domain space, a person shall not do anything or operate the .gh domain name or any domain name associated with the country except as provided under this Act.
texts.text: After the assumption of responsibility for the .gh domain space, a person shall not do anything or operate the .gh domain name or any domain name associated with the country except as provided under this Act.

texts.label: list_item
texts.orig: (3)  A  person  who  contravenes  subsection  (2)  commits  an  offence  and  is  liable  on summary conviction to a fine of not more than one thousand penalty units or to a term of imprisonment of not more than three years or to both.
texts.text: A  person  who  contravenes  subsection  (2)  commits  an  offence  and  is  liable  on summary conviction to a fine of not more than one thousand penalty units or to a term of imprisonment of not more than three years or to both.

texts.label: section_header
texts.orig: Governance of the Registry
texts.text: Governance of the Registry

texts.label: section_header
texts.orig: Governing Body of the Registry
texts.text: Governing Body of the Registry

texts.label: list_item
texts.orig: 5. (1) The governing body of the Registry is a Board consisting of:
texts.text: (1) The governing body of the Registry is a Board consisting of:

texts.label: list_item
texts.orig: (a) the Executive Director of the Registry;
texts.text: (a) the Executive Director of the Registry;

texts.label: list_item
texts.orig: (b) two persons nominated by the Minister, one of whom shall be nominated from one of the agencies of the Ministry;
texts.text: (b) two persons nominated by the Minister, one of whom shall be nominated from one of the agencies of the Ministry;

texts.label: list_item
texts.orig: (c) one person nominated by the Minister responsible for the Interior from the law enforcement agencies;
texts.text: (c) one person nominated by the Minister responsible for the Interior from the law enforcement agencies;

texts.label: list_item
texts.orig: (d) one person nominated by the internet technical community;
texts.text: (d) one person nominated by the internet technical community;

texts.label: list_item
texts.orig: (e) one person nominated by the public universities;
texts.text: (e) one person nominated by the public universities;

texts.label: list_item
texts.orig: (f) one person nominated by the private universities;
texts.text: (f) one person nominated by the private universities;

texts.label: list_item
texts.orig: (g) one  legal  expert  with  at  least  seven  years'  experience  in  intellectual property law and cyber law; and
texts.text: (g) one  legal  expert  with  at  least  seven  years'  experience  in  intellectual property law and cyber law; and

texts.label: list_item
texts.orig: (h) one person nominated by licensed local registrars.
texts.text: (h) one person nominated by licensed local registrars.

texts.label: list_item
texts.orig: (2)  The members of the Board shall be appointed by the President in accordance with article 70 of the Constitution.
texts.text: The members of the Board shall be appointed by the President in accordance with article 70 of the Constitution.

texts.label: list_item
texts.orig: (3)  The President shall appoint one of the members to be the chairperson.
texts.text: The President shall appoint one of the members to be the chairperson.

texts.label: list_item
texts.orig: (4)  The Board shall ensure the proper and effective performance of the functions of the Registry.
texts.text: The Board shall ensure the proper and effective performance of the functions of the Registry.

texts.label: list_item
texts.orig: (5)  Notwithstanding  any  other  provision  in  this  section,  the  composition  of  the governing board shall include not less than three (3) women as members.
texts.text: Notwithstanding  any  other  provision  in  this  section,  the  composition  of  the governing board shall include not less than three (3) women as members.

texts.label: section_header
texts.orig: Tenure of office of Board members
texts.text: Tenure of office of Board members

texts.label: list_item
texts.orig: 6. (1) A member of the Board shall hold office for a period not exceeding four years and is eligible for reappointment, but a member shall not be appointed for more than two terms in succession.
texts.text: (1) A member of the Board shall hold office for a period not exceeding four years and is eligible for reappointment, but a member shall not be appointed for more than two terms in succession.

texts.label: list_item
texts.orig: (2)  Where a member of the Board, resigns, dies, is removed from office or is for a reasonable cause unable to act as a member, the Minister shall notify the President of  the  vacancy  and  the  President  shall,  acting  on  the  advice  of  the  nominating authority and in consultation with the Council  of State appoint another person to hold office for the unexpired portion of the member's term of office.
texts.text: Where a member of the Board, resigns, dies, is removed from office or is for a reasonable cause unable to act as a member, the Minister shall notify the President of  the  vacancy  and  the  President  shall,  acting  on  the  advice  of  the  nominating authority and in consultation with the Council  of State appoint another person to hold office for the unexpired portion of the member's term of office.

texts.label: list_item
texts.orig: (3)  A member of the Board, who is absent from three consecutive meetings of the Board without reasonable cause ceases to be a member of the Board.
texts.text: A member of the Board, who is absent from three consecutive meetings of the Board without reasonable cause ceases to be a member of the Board.

texts.label: list_item
texts.orig: (4)  A member of the Board, may at any time resign from office in writing addressed to the President through the Minister.
texts.text: A member of the Board, may at any time resign from office in writing addressed to the President through the Minister.

texts.label: list_item
texts.orig: (5)  The President may, by letter addressed to a member, revoke the appointment of that member.
texts.text: The President may, by letter addressed to a member, revoke the appointment of that member.

texts.label: section_header
texts.orig: Meetings of the Board
texts.text: Meetings of the Board

texts.label: list_item
texts.orig: 7. (1) The Board shall meet at least once every three months for the despatch of business at the times and in the places determined by the chairperson.
texts.text: (1) The Board shall meet at least once every three months for the despatch of business at the times and in the places determined by the chairperson.

texts.label: list_item
texts.orig: (2)  The  chairperson shall at the request in writing of not less than one-third of the membership of the Board convene an extraordinary meeting of the Board at the place and time determined by the chairperson.
texts.text: The  chairperson shall at the request in writing of not less than one-third of the membership of the Board convene an extraordinary meeting of the Board at the place and time determined by the chairperson.

texts.label: list_item
texts.orig: (3)  The quorum at a meeting of the Board shall be two thirds of members of the Board or a greater number determined by the Board in respect of specific matters.
texts.text: The quorum at a meeting of the Board shall be two thirds of members of the Board or a greater number determined by the Board in respect of specific matters.

texts.label: list_item
texts.orig: (4)  The chairperson shall preside at meetings of the Board and in the absence of the chairperson a member of the Board elected by the members present from among their number shall preside.
texts.text: The chairperson shall preside at meetings of the Board and in the absence of the chairperson a member of the Board elected by the members present from among their number shall preside.

texts.label: list_item
texts.orig: (5)  Matters before the Board shall be decided by a majority of the members present and voting and in the event of an equality of votes, the person presiding shall have a casting vote.
texts.text: Matters before the Board shall be decided by a majority of the members present and voting and in the event of an equality of votes, the person presiding shall have a casting vote.

texts.label: list_item
texts.orig: (6)  The Board may co-opt a person to attend a Board meeting, but that person shall not vote on a matter for decision at the meeting.
texts.text: The Board may co-opt a person to attend a Board meeting, but that person shall not vote on a matter for decision at the meeting.

texts.label: list_item
texts.orig: (7)  The proceedings of the Board shall not be invalidated because of a vacancy among the members or a defect in the appointment or qualification of a member.
texts.text: The proceedings of the Board shall not be invalidated because of a vacancy among the members or a defect in the appointment or qualification of a member.

texts.label: list_item
texts.orig: (8)  Subject to this section, the Board may determine the procedure for its meetings.
texts.text: Subject to this section, the Board may determine the procedure for its meetings.

texts.label: section_header
texts.orig: Disclosure of interest
texts.text: Disclosure of interest

texts.label: list_item
texts.orig: 8. (1) A member of the Board who has an interest in a matter for consideration by the Board  shall  disclose  in  writing  the  nature  of  that  interest  and  is  disqualified  from participating in the deliberations of the Board in respect of that matter.
texts.text: (1) A member of the Board who has an interest in a matter for consideration by the Board  shall  disclose  in  writing  the  nature  of  that  interest  and  is  disqualified  from participating in the deliberations of the Board in respect of that matter.

texts.label: list_item
texts.orig: (2)  A member who contravenes subsection (1) ceases to be a member.
texts.text: A member who contravenes subsection (1) ceases to be a member.

texts.label: section_header
texts.orig: Establishment of committees
texts.text: Establishment of committees

texts.label: list_item
texts.orig: 9. (1) The Board may appoint committees consisting of members of the Board or nonmembers or both to perform a function.
texts.text: (1) The Board may appoint committees consisting of members of the Board or nonmembers or both to perform a function.

texts.label: list_item
texts.orig: (2)  The membership of a committee appointed under this section and the tenure of office of its members shall be coterminous with the duration of their membership of the Board.
texts.text: The membership of a committee appointed under this section and the tenure of office of its members shall be coterminous with the duration of their membership of the Board.

texts.label: list_item
texts.orig: (3)  Non-members shall hold office for a period not exceeding four years and may be eligible for re-appointment but shall not be appointed for more than two successive terms.
texts.text: Non-members shall hold office for a period not exceeding four years and may be eligible for re-appointment but shall not be appointed for more than two successive terms.

texts.label: list_item
texts.orig: (4)  A committee of the Board may be chaired by a member of the Board.
texts.text: A committee of the Board may be chaired by a member of the Board.

texts.label: list_item
texts.orig: (5)  A committee of the Board composed of non-members only shall be advisory.
texts.text: A committee of the Board composed of non-members only shall be advisory.

texts.label: section_header
texts.orig: Allowances
texts.text: Allowances

texts.label: list_item
texts.orig: 10. Members  of  the  Board  and  members  of  a  committee  of  the  Board  shall  be  paid allowances approved by the Minister in consultation with the Minister responsible for Finance.
texts.text: Members  of  the  Board  and  members  of  a  committee  of  the  Board  shall  be  paid allowances approved by the Minister in consultation with the Minister responsible for Finance.

texts.label: section_header
texts.orig: Policy Directives
texts.text: Policy Directives

texts.label: list_item
texts.orig: 11. The Minister may, from time to time, publish policy directives relating to the regulation and maintenance of the .gh domain name space.
texts.text: The Minister may, from time to time, publish policy directives relating to the regulation and maintenance of the .gh domain name space.

texts.label: section_header
texts.orig: The Executive Director
texts.text: The Executive Director

texts.label: list_item
texts.orig: 12. (1) The President shall, in accordance with article 195 of the Constitution, appoint an Executive Director for the Registry.
texts.text: (1) The President shall, in accordance with article 195 of the Constitution, appoint an Executive Director for the Registry.

texts.label: list_item
texts.orig: (2)  The Executive Director shall hold office on the terms and conditions specified in the letter of appointment.
texts.text: The Executive Director shall hold office on the terms and conditions specified in the letter of appointment.

texts.label: section_header
texts.orig: Functions of the Executive Director
texts.text: Functions of the Executive Director

texts.label: list_item
texts.orig: 13. (1) The Executive Director is responsible for the day-to-day administration of the affairs of the Registry and is answerable to the Board in the performance of functions under this Act.
texts.text: (1) The Executive Director is responsible for the day-to-day administration of the affairs of the Registry and is answerable to the Board in the performance of functions under this Act.

texts.label: list_item
texts.orig: (2)  The Executive Director shall perform any other functions determined by the Board.
texts.text: The Executive Director shall perform any other functions determined by the Board.

texts.label: list_item
texts.orig: (3)  The Executive Director may delegate a function to an officer of the Registry but shall  not  be  relieved from  the  ultimate  responsibility  for  the performance  of  the delegated function.
texts.text: The Executive Director may delegate a function to an officer of the Registry but shall  not  be  relieved from  the  ultimate  responsibility  for  the performance  of  the delegated function.

texts.label: section_header
texts.orig: Duties and liability of the Board
texts.text: Duties and liability of the Board

texts.label: list_item
texts.orig: 14. (1) The duties of directors contained in Part Q of Chapter two of the Companies Act, 2019 (Act 992) shall apply to members of the Board.
texts.text: (1) The duties of directors contained in Part Q of Chapter two of the Companies Act, 2019 (Act 992) shall apply to members of the Board.

texts.label: list_item
texts.orig: (2)  A member of the Board is not personally liable for damage or injury to a third party that arises in the execution of an official duty of that member, if the member at all material times acted in good faith.
texts.text: A member of the Board is not personally liable for damage or injury to a third party that arises in the execution of an official duty of that member, if the member at all material times acted in good faith.

texts.orig: Appointment of other staff
texts.text: Appointment of other staff

texts.label: list_item
texts.orig: 15. (1) The Board shall in consultation with the Public Services Commissions appoint other staff of the Registry that are necessary for the proper and effective performance of its functions.
texts.text: (1) The Board shall in consultation with the Public Services Commissions appoint other staff of the Registry that are necessary for the proper and effective performance of its functions.

texts.label: list_item
texts.orig: (2)  Other  public  officers  may  be  transferred  or  seconded  to  the  Registry  or  may otherwise give assistance to it.
texts.text: Other  public  officers  may  be  transferred  or  seconded  to  the  Registry  or  may otherwise give assistance to it.

texts.label: list_item
texts.orig: (3)  The  Registry  may  engage  the  services  of  advisers  and  consultants  on  the recommendations of the Board.
texts.text: The  Registry  may  engage  the  services  of  advisers  and  consultants  on  the recommendations of the Board.

texts.label: section_header

texts.text: Licensing of Registrars and Creation of Central Registry

texts.label: section_header
texts.orig: Operation as a registrar
texts.text: Operation as a registrar

texts.label: list_item
texts.orig: 16. (1) A person shall not act as a registrar unless licensed to do so by the Registry.
texts.text: (1) A person shall not act as a registrar unless licensed to do so by the Registry.

texts.label: list_item
texts.orig: (2)  A person who contravenes subsection (1) commits an offence and is liable upon summary conviction:
texts.text: A person who contravenes subsection (1) commits an offence and is liable upon summary conviction:

texts.label: list_item
texts.orig: (a) in the case of a body corporate or other body of persons, to a fine of not less than two thousand penalty units and not more than seven thousand penalty units;
texts.text: (a) in the case of a body corporate or other body of persons, to a fine of not less than two thousand penalty units and not more than seven thousand penalty units;

texts.label: list_item
texts.orig: (b) in the case of a director of a body corporate or other body of persons, to a fine of not less than one thousand penalty units and not more than five thousand penalty units; and
texts.text: (b) in the case of a director of a body corporate or other body of persons, to a fine of not less than one thousand penalty units and not more than five thousand penalty units; and

texts.label: list_item
texts.orig: (c) in the case of an individual, to a fine of not less than one thousand penalty units and not more than three thousand penalty units.
texts.text: (c) in the case of an individual, to a fine of not less than one thousand penalty units and not more than three thousand penalty units.

texts.label: list_item
texts.orig: (3) A person who is convicted of an offence under subsection (2) shall immediately cease operation as a registrar.
texts.text: A person who is convicted of an offence under subsection (2) shall immediately cease operation as a registrar.

texts.label: section_header
texts.orig: Application for a registrar licence
texts.text: Application for a registrar licence

texts.label: list_item
texts.orig: 17. (1) An application to be licensed as a registrar shall be made in the prescribed manner and subject to the prescribed fees.
texts.text: (1) An application to be licensed as a registrar shall be made in the prescribed manner and subject to the prescribed fees.

texts.label: list_item
texts.orig: (2)  The Registry may, within sixty days following the receipt of a complete application, grant or refuse the application.
texts.text: The Registry may, within sixty days following the receipt of a complete application, grant or refuse the application.

texts.label: list_item
texts.orig: (3)  The Registry may, where it grants the licence, impose terms and conditions where the Registry deems it appropriate.
texts.text: The Registry may, where it grants the licence, impose terms and conditions where the Registry deems it appropriate.

texts.label: list_item
texts.orig: (4)  The Registry may refuse an application where:
texts.text: The Registry may refuse an application where:

texts.label: list_item
texts.orig: (a) the application is incomplete;
texts.text: (a) the application is incomplete;

texts.label: list_item
texts.orig: (b) the application contains false or misleading information;
texts.text: (b) the application contains false or misleading information;

texts.label: list_item
texts.orig: (c) the application does not meet the technical requirements prescribed by the Registry; or
texts.text: (c) the application does not meet the technical requirements prescribed by the Registry; or

texts.label: list_item
texts.orig: (d) the Registry is convinced upon reasonable grounds that the applicant is incapable of performing the functions of a registrar.
texts.text: (d) the Registry is convinced upon reasonable grounds that the applicant is incapable of performing the functions of a registrar.

texts.label: list_item
texts.orig: (5)  An  applicant  whose  application  is  refused  may  resubmit  the  application  if  the deficiencies which formed the basis of the refusal of the initial application have been rectified.
texts.text: An  applicant  whose  application  is  refused  may  resubmit  the  application  if  the deficiencies which formed the basis of the refusal of the initial application have been rectified.

texts.label: list_item
texts.orig: (6)  A licence granted under this Act shall be renewed as prescribed by the Registry.
texts.text: A licence granted under this Act shall be renewed as prescribed by the Registry.

texts.label: list_item
texts.orig: (7)  An application for renewal shall be made in the prescribed manner and subject to the prescribed fees.
texts.text: An application for renewal shall be made in the prescribed manner and subject to the prescribed fees.

texts.label: section_header
texts.orig: Creation of one central registry
texts.text: Creation of one central registry

texts.label: list_item
texts.orig: 18. (1) There shall be only one central registry of all .gh domain names registered in the Republic.
texts.text: (1) There shall be only one central registry of all .gh domain names registered in the Republic.

texts.label: list_item
texts.orig: (2)  The Registry shall have the sole responsibility to keep and maintain the central registry.
texts.text: The Registry shall have the sole responsibility to keep and maintain the central registry.

texts.label: list_item
texts.orig: (3)  No person shall maintain or update a repository, or administer a country domain name other than the Registry.
texts.text: No person shall maintain or update a repository, or administer a country domain name other than the Registry.

texts.label: list_item
texts.orig: (4)  A person who contravenes subsection (3) commits an offence and is liable upon summary conviction:
texts.text: A person who contravenes subsection (3) commits an offence and is liable upon summary conviction:

texts.label: list_item
texts.orig: (a) in the case of a body corporate or other body of persons, to a fine of not less  than  five  thousand  penalty  units  and  not  more  than  ten  thousand penalty units;
texts.text: (a) in the case of a body corporate or other body of persons, to a fine of not less  than  five  thousand  penalty  units  and  not  more  than  ten  thousand penalty units;

texts.label: list_item
texts.orig: (b) in the case of a director of a body corporate or other body of persons, to a fine of not less than one thousand penalty units and not more than three thousand penalty units; and
texts.text: (b) in the case of a director of a body corporate or other body of persons, to a fine of not less than one thousand penalty units and not more than three thousand penalty units; and

texts.label: list_item
texts.orig: (c) in the case of an individual, to a fine of not less than one thousand penalty units and not more than five thousand penalty units.
texts.text: (c) in the case of an individual, to a fine of not less than one thousand penalty units and not more than five thousand penalty units.

texts.label: list_item
texts.orig: (5)  The  Registry  shall  keep  and  maintain  a  register  of  registrars  in  which  shall  be recorded of the registrar:
texts.text: The  Registry  shall  keep  and  maintain  a  register  of  registrars  in  which  shall  be recorded of the registrar:

texts.label: list_item
texts.orig: (a) the name;
texts.text: (a) the name;

texts.label: list_item
texts.orig: (b) the registration number;
texts.text: (b) the registration number;

texts.label: list_item
texts.orig: (c) the country of incorporation;
texts.text: (c) the country of incorporation;

texts.label: list_item
texts.orig: (d) the address; and
texts.text: (d) the address; and

texts.label: list_item
texts.orig: (e) any other information that the Registry shall prescribe.
texts.text: (e) any other information that the Registry shall prescribe.

texts.label: list_item
texts.orig: (6)  The  Registry  shall  publish  details  in  the  register of  registrars on  the  Registry's website and any other media which the Registry deems fit.
texts.text: The  Registry  shall  publish  details  in  the  register of  registrars on  the  Registry's website and any other media which the Registry deems fit.

texts.label: section_header
texts.orig: Suspension and revocation of licences
texts.text: Suspension and revocation of licences

texts.label: list_item
texts.orig: 19. (1) The Registry may revoke or suspend a licence issued under this section where the registrar:
texts.text: (1) The Registry may revoke or suspend a licence issued under this section where the registrar:

texts.label: list_item
texts.orig: (a) engages in misconduct which harms consumers or the public interest;
texts.text: (a) engages in misconduct which harms consumers or the public interest;

texts.label: list_item
texts.orig: (b) is held liable for abuse;
texts.text: (b) is held liable for abuse;

texts.label: list_item
texts.orig: (c) fails to meet the ongoing requirements prescribed by the Minister; or
texts.text: (c) fails to meet the ongoing requirements prescribed by the Minister; or

texts.label: list_item
texts.orig: (d) contravenes any orders, guidelines or directives issued by the Registry or the Minister.
texts.text: (d) contravenes any orders, guidelines or directives issued by the Registry or the Minister.

texts.label: list_item
texts.orig: (2)  The Registry may prescribe additional grounds for the revocation or suspension of a licence.
texts.text: The Registry may prescribe additional grounds for the revocation or suspension of a licence.

texts.label: list_item
texts.orig: (3)  Subsection (1) does not limit the power of the Registry to take any other remedial or penal action against a registrar.
texts.text: Subsection (1) does not limit the power of the Registry to take any other remedial or penal action against a registrar.

texts.label: section_header
texts.orig: Security Operations Centre
texts.text: Security Operations Centre

texts.label: section_header
texts.orig: Domain Name System (DNS) Security Operations Centre
texts.text: Domain Name System (DNS) Security Operations Centre

texts.label: list_item
texts.orig: 20. (1) The Registry shall establish and maintain a mandatory DNS Security Operations Centre which shall monitor .gh domain resolutions, traffic, and logs using automated, manual, or hybrid methods as appropriate, to detect threats and attacks.
texts.text: (1) The Registry shall establish and maintain a mandatory DNS Security Operations Centre which shall monitor .gh domain resolutions, traffic, and logs using automated, manual, or hybrid methods as appropriate, to detect threats and attacks.

texts.label: list_item
texts.orig: (2)  The  DNS  Security  Operations  Centre  shall  be  responsible  for  initiating  and coordinating appropriate response actions, including but not limited to containment, notification of affected parties, mitigation of threats, and post-incident analysis.
texts.text: The  DNS  Security  Operations  Centre  shall  be  responsible  for  initiating  and coordinating appropriate response actions, including but not limited to containment, notification of affected parties, mitigation of threats, and post-incident analysis.

texts.label: list_item
texts.orig: (3)  All metropolitan, municipal  and  district  assemblies',  government  ministries', agencies'  and  departments',  and  security  agencies'  domain  names  shall  be integrated into the DNS Security Operations Centre.
texts.text: All metropolitan, municipal  and  district  assemblies',  government  ministries', agencies'  and  departments',  and  security  agencies'  domain  names  shall  be integrated into the DNS Security Operations Centre.

texts.label: list_item
texts.orig: (4)  The DNS Security Operations Centre shall publish quarterly and yearly reports on the threats detected in the domain name system.
texts.text: The DNS Security Operations Centre shall publish quarterly and yearly reports on the threats detected in the domain name system.

texts.label: section_header
texts.orig: Mandatory use of .gh domain
texts.text: Mandatory use of .gh domain

texts.label: section_header
texts.orig: Mandatory registration
texts.text: Mandatory registration

texts.label: list_item
texts.orig: 21. (1) All entities legally registered or operating in the Republic shall be required to:
texts.text: (1) All entities legally registered or operating in the Republic shall be required to:

texts.label: list_item
texts.orig: (a) register and maintain an active .gh domain name for any official website or digital platform intended for public access; and
texts.text: (a) register and maintain an active .gh domain name for any official website or digital platform intended for public access; and

texts.label: list_item
texts.orig: (b) use  the  .gh  domain  name  for  all  official  digital  correspondence  and transactions conducted within or from the Republic.
texts.text: (b) use  the  .gh  domain  name  for  all  official  digital  correspondence  and transactions conducted within or from the Republic.

texts.label: list_item
texts.orig: (2)  Entities currently not using .gh domains shall transition to a .gh domain within six months of the coming into force of this Act to comply with subsection (1).
texts.text: Entities currently not using .gh domains shall transition to a .gh domain within six months of the coming into force of this Act to comply with subsection (1).

texts.label: section_header
texts.orig: Exemptions
texts.text: Exemptions

texts.label: list_item
texts.orig: 22. (1) Notwithstanding section 20(1), the Registry in consultation with the Minister may grant an exemption to an entity if:
texts.text: (1) Notwithstanding section 20(1), the Registry in consultation with the Minister may grant an exemption to an entity if:

texts.label: list_item
texts.orig: (a) its digital presence is hosted exclusively outside the Republic and does not target Ghanaian users; and
texts.text: (a) its digital presence is hosted exclusively outside the Republic and does not target Ghanaian users; and

texts.label: list_item
texts.orig: (b) it  operates  as  a  multinational  organisation  subject  to  foreign  digital jurisdiction.
texts.text: (b) it  operates  as  a  multinational  organisation  subject  to  foreign  digital jurisdiction.

texts.label: list_item
texts.orig: (2) Any exemption granted under subsection (1) shall be:
texts.text: Any exemption granted under subsection (1) shall be:

texts.label: list_item
texts.orig: (a) upon application by the entity in the prescribed form;
texts.text: (a) upon application by the entity in the prescribed form;

texts.label: list_item
texts.orig: (b) time-bound and renewable upon review; and
texts.text: (b) time-bound and renewable upon review; and

texts.label: list_item
texts.orig: (c) published in the Gazette.
texts.text: (c) published in the Gazette.

texts.label: section_header
texts.orig: Penalties for Non-Compliance
texts.text: Penalties for Non-Compliance

texts.label: text
texts.orig: 23. (1) Any entity that fails to comply with this section shall be liable to:
texts.text: 23. (1) Any entity that fails to comply with this section shall be liable to:

texts.label: list_item
texts.orig: (a) an administrative penalty of not less than one thousand penalty units and not more ten thousand penalty units per year of non-compliance;
texts.text: (a) an administrative penalty of not less than one thousand penalty units and not more ten thousand penalty units per year of non-compliance;

texts.label: list_item
texts.orig: (b) suspension or revocation of business and regulatory licences for repeated non-compliance in accordance with regulatory procedure of the relevant sector; and
texts.text: (b) suspension or revocation of business and regulatory licences for repeated non-compliance in accordance with regulatory procedure of the relevant sector; and

texts.label: list_item
texts.orig: (c) disqualification  from  participating  in  public  procurement  or  tendering processes for a period of up to two years.
texts.text: (c) disqualification  from  participating  in  public  procurement  or  tendering processes for a period of up to two years.

texts.label: list_item
texts.orig: (2)  A  director  or  officer  of  a  corporate  body  who  knowingly  permits  the  body  to contravene this Act shall be personally liable to an administrative penalty of not more than five thousand penalty units.
texts.text: A  director  or  officer  of  a  corporate  body  who  knowingly  permits  the  body  to contravene this Act shall be personally liable to an administrative penalty of not more than five thousand penalty units.

texts.label: section_header
texts.orig: Monitoring and Inspection
texts.text: Monitoring and Inspection

texts.label: list_item
texts.orig: 24. (1)  The Ministry, in collaboration with  the  Registry  shall  establish  a  Domain Compliance Unit (DCU) to:
texts.text: (1)  The Ministry, in collaboration with  the  Registry  shall  establish  a  Domain Compliance Unit (DCU) to:

texts.label: list_item
texts.orig: (a) audit and monitor domain name usage by entities; and
texts.text: (a) audit and monitor domain name usage by entities; and

texts.label: list_item
texts.orig: (b) serve compliance notices for violations of this Act.
texts.text: (b) serve compliance notices for violations of this Act.

texts.label: list_item
texts.orig: (2) The Domain Compliance unit shall be made up of officers of the Registry and persons appointed by the Minister.
texts.text: The Domain Compliance unit shall be made up of officers of the Registry and persons appointed by the Minister.

texts.label: section_header
texts.orig: Entities in breach
texts.text: Entities in breach

texts.label: list_item
texts.orig: 25. (1) The Registry shall maintain and publish on its website a list of:
texts.text: (1) The Registry shall maintain and publish on its website a list of:

texts.label: list_item
texts.orig: (a) entities in breach of this Act;
texts.text: (a) entities in breach of this Act;

texts.label: list_item
texts.orig: (b) entities granted exemptions or temporary waivers; and
texts.text: (b) entities granted exemptions or temporary waivers; and

texts.label: list_item
texts.orig: (c) enforcement actions undertaken and their outcomes.
texts.text: (c) enforcement actions undertaken and their outcomes.

texts.label: list_item
texts.orig: (2) The  names  of  offending  entities  may  be  published  in  national  newspapers, government  gazettes,  and  regulatory  bulletins  as  part  of  a  compliance transparency initiative taking into consideration fundamental human rights of affected persons.

texts.orig: Court orders and judicial support
texts.text: Court orders and judicial support

texts.orig: 26. The Registry shall have the power to apply to the High Court of Ghana for an order to:
texts.text: The Registry shall have the power to apply to the High Court of Ghana for an order to:

texts.label: list_item
texts.orig: (a) seize, block, or deactivate any domain name registered in contravention of this Act;
texts.text: (a) seize, block, or deactivate any domain name registered in contravention of this Act;

texts.label: list_item
texts.orig: (b) take down or delete malicious domain names;
texts.text: (b) take down or delete malicious domain names;

texts.label: list_item
texts.orig: (c) compel internet service providers, web hosts, or any other relevant entity to cease offering services to the offending domain; or
texts.text: (c) compel internet service providers, web hosts, or any other relevant entity to cease offering services to the offending domain; or

texts.label: list_item
texts.orig: (d) authorise  entry  into  premises  to  inspect  digital  systems  under  warrant, where reasonable suspicion of concealment or fraud exists.
texts.text: (d) authorise  entry  into  premises  to  inspect  digital  systems  under  warrant, where reasonable suspicion of concealment or fraud exists.

texts.text: Funds of the Registry

texts.orig: 27. The funds of the Registry include:
texts.text: The funds of the Registry include:

texts.label: list_item
texts.orig: (a) moneys provided by Parliament;
texts.text: (a) moneys provided by Parliament;

texts.text: (b) 2% of the Digital Economy and Innovation Development Fund;

texts.text: (c) donations, grants and gifts;

texts.text: (e) any  other  moneys  that  are  approved  by  the  Minister  responsible  for Finance.

texts.text: The expenses of the Registry shall be paid from moneys provided from the funds of the Registry.

texts.orig: 29. Subject  to  article  181  of  the  Constitution,  section  76  of  the  Public  Financial Management Act, 2016 (Act 921) and any other relevant enactment, the registry may obtain loans and any other credit facility on the guarantee of the Government from a bank or any other financial institution approved by the Minister responsible for Finance.

texts.label: section_header
texts.orig: Accounts and audit
texts.text: Accounts and audit

texts.label: list_item
texts.orig: 31. (1) The Board shall keep books of account and proper records in relation to them in the form approved by the Auditor-General.
texts.text: (1) The Board shall keep books of account and proper records in relation to them in the form approved by the Auditor-General.

texts.label: list_item
texts.orig: (2)  The Board shall submit the accounts of the Registry to the Auditor-General for audit within three months after the end of the financial year.
texts.text: The Board shall submit the accounts of the Registry to the Auditor-General for audit within three months after the end of the financial year.

texts.label: list_item
texts.orig: (3)  The  Auditor-General  shall,  not  later  than  three  months  after  the  receipt  of  the accounts, audit the accounts and forward a copy of the audit report to the Minister.
texts.text: The  Auditor-General  shall,  not  later  than  three  months  after  the  receipt  of  the accounts, audit the accounts and forward a copy of the audit report to the Minister.

texts.label: list_item
texts.orig: (4)  The  financial  year  of  the  Registry  is  the  same  as  the  financial  year  of  the Government.
texts.text: The  financial  year  of  the  Registry  is  the  same  as  the  financial  year  of  the Government.

texts.text: Internal Audit Unit

texts.orig: 32. (1) The Registry shall have an Internal Audit Unit in accordance with section 83 of the Public Financial Management Act, 2016 (Act 921).
texts.text: (1) The Registry shall have an Internal Audit Unit in accordance with section 83 of the Public Financial Management Act, 2016 (Act 921).

texts.label: list_item
texts.orig: (2)  The  Internal  Audit  Unit  shall  be  headed  by  an  Internal  Auditor  who  shall  be appointed in accordance with the Internal Audit Agency Act, 2003 (Act 658).
texts.text: The  Internal  Audit  Unit  shall  be  headed  by  an  Internal  Auditor  who  shall  be appointed in accordance with the Internal Audit Agency Act, 2003 (Act 658).

texts.label: list_item
texts.orig: (3)  The Internal Auditor is responsible for the internal audit of the Registry.
texts.text: The Internal Auditor is responsible for the internal audit of the Registry.

texts.text: The Internal Auditor shall, in accordance with subsection (4) of section 16 of the Internal Audit Agency Act, 2003 (Act 658), submit a copy of each report prepared under this section to the Executive Director and the chairperson of the Board.

texts.text: Establishment of the Domain Name Registry Fund

texts.label: list_item
texts.orig: 34. There shall be established a fund to be known as the Domain Name Registry Fund.
texts.text: There shall be established a fund to be known as the Domain Name Registry Fund.

texts.orig: 35. The Fund shall be applied to achieve the following objectives:
texts.text: The Fund shall be applied to achieve the following objectives:

texts.label: list_item
texts.orig: (a) digital inclusion for small and medium enterprises;

texts.label: list_item
texts.orig: (d) any other objective as the Minister may prescribe.

texts.orig: (d) donations, grants and gifts; and

texts.label: list_item
texts.orig: (e) any other moneys that may lawfully accrue to the Fund.
texts.text: (e) any other moneys that may lawfully accrue to the Fund.

texts.orig: 39. (1) Projects for which moneys from the Fund are disbursed shall satisfy the criteria laid out in the order of priority.

texts.label: section_header
texts.orig: Dispute Resolution
texts.text: Dispute Resolution

texts.label: section_header
texts.orig: Resolution of Disputes
texts.text: Resolution of Disputes

texts.label: list_item
texts.orig: 41. (1) The Minister shall establish a dispute resolution process to resolve:
texts.text: (1) The Minister shall establish a dispute resolution process to resolve:

texts.label: list_item
texts.orig: (a) disputes between or among registrars;
texts.text: (a) disputes between or among registrars;

texts.label: list_item
texts.orig: (b) disputes between registrars and registrants;
texts.text: (b) disputes between registrars and registrants;

texts.label: list_item
texts.orig: (c) disputes between the Registry and any registrar; and
texts.text: (c) disputes between the Registry and any registrar; and

texts.label: list_item
texts.orig: (d) disputes between the Registry and any registrant.
texts.text: (d) disputes between the Registry and any registrant.

texts.label: list_item
texts.orig: (2)  No party to a dispute described under subsection (1) shall institute an action in court unless the dispute resolution procedure established under this Act has been exhausted.
texts.text: No party to a dispute described under subsection (1) shall institute an action in court unless the dispute resolution procedure established under this Act has been exhausted.

texts.label: list_item
texts.orig: (3)  The Minister may by legislative instrument make regulations on the manner and procedure for the resolution of disputes.
texts.text: The Minister may by legislative instrument make regulations on the manner and procedure for the resolution of disputes.

texts.label: list_item
texts.orig: (4)  The procedure shall be in line with the Uniform Domain Name Dispute Resolution Policy and its Rules.
texts.text: The procedure shall be in line with the Uniform Domain Name Dispute Resolution Policy and its Rules.

texts.label: section_header
texts.orig: Dispute Resolution Committee
texts.text: Dispute Resolution Committee

texts.label: list_item
texts.orig: 42. (1) The Board shall establish a Dispute Resolution Committee which shall consist of five  members  with  relevant  experience  in alternative  dispute  resolution,  intellectual property, and internet law, policy and governance.
texts.text: (1) The Board shall establish a Dispute Resolution Committee which shall consist of five  members  with  relevant  experience  in alternative  dispute  resolution,  intellectual property, and internet law, policy and governance.

texts.label: list_item
texts.orig: (2)  A three-member panel of the Committee shall expeditiously hear, inquire into and investigate any matter which is brought before it.
texts.text: A three-member panel of the Committee shall expeditiously hear, inquire into and investigate any matter which is brought before it.

texts.label: list_item
texts.orig: (3)  The Committee shall determine the periods that are reasonably necessary for the fair  and  adequate presentation  of  the  matter  by  the  respective  parties  and  the Registry may require those matters to be presented within the periods.
texts.text: The Committee shall determine the periods that are reasonably necessary for the fair  and  adequate presentation  of  the  matter  by  the  respective  parties  and  the Registry may require those matters to be presented within the periods.

texts.label: list_item
texts.orig: (4)  The Committee may require evidence or arguments to be presented in writing and may decide the matters upon which it will hear oral evidence or written arguments.
texts.text: The Committee may require evidence or arguments to be presented in writing and may decide the matters upon which it will hear oral evidence or written arguments.

texts.label: list_item
texts.orig: (5)  Each party to a matter is entitled to appear at the hearing and may be represented by a lawyer or any other person.
texts.text: Each party to a matter is entitled to appear at the hearing and may be represented by a lawyer or any other person.

texts.label: list_item
texts.orig: (6)  The Committee shall communicate its decision to the parties within thirty days of receipt  of  the  dispute  provided  that  there  are  no  exceptional  circumstances affecting the dispute.
texts.text: The Committee shall communicate its decision to the parties within thirty days of receipt  of  the  dispute  provided  that  there  are  no  exceptional  circumstances affecting the dispute.

texts.label: list_item
texts.orig: (7)  Appeals from a decision by the Dispute Resolution Committee may be submitted to the High Court.
texts.text: Appeals from a decision by the Dispute Resolution Committee may be submitted to the High Court.

texts.label: section_header
texts.orig: Powers of the Dispute Resolution Committee
texts.text: Powers of the Dispute Resolution Committee

texts.label: list_item
texts.orig: 43. The Dispute Resolution Committee may:
texts.text: The Dispute Resolution Committee may:

texts.label: list_item
texts.orig: (a) issue summons to compel the attendance of witnesses under the hand of the Executive Director of the Registry;
texts.text: (a) issue summons to compel the attendance of witnesses under the hand of the Executive Director of the Registry;

texts.label: list_item
texts.orig: (b) examine witnesses on oath, affirmation or otherwise;
texts.text: (b) examine witnesses on oath, affirmation or otherwise;

texts.label: list_item
texts.orig: (c) compel the production of documents;
texts.text: (c) compel the production of documents;

texts.label: list_item
texts.orig: (d) cite a person for trial at the High Court for contempt;
texts.text: (d) cite a person for trial at the High Court for contempt;

texts.label: list_item
texts.orig: (e) make a declaration setting out the rights and obligations of the parties to the dispute;
texts.text: (e) make a declaration setting out the rights and obligations of the parties to the dispute;

texts.label: list_item
texts.orig: (f) make provisional or interim orders or awards that relate to the matter or part of it, or give directions in pursuance of the hearing;
texts.text: (f) make provisional or interim orders or awards that relate to the matter or part of it, or give directions in pursuance of the hearing;

texts.label: list_item
texts.orig: (g) dismiss or refrain from hearing or determining a matter, in whole or in part, if it appears that the matter, or part of the matter, is trivial or vexatious or that  further  proceedings  are  not  necessary  or  desirable  in  the  public interest;
texts.text: (g) dismiss or refrain from hearing or determining a matter, in whole or in part, if it appears that the matter, or part of the matter, is trivial or vexatious or that  further  proceedings  are  not  necessary  or  desirable  in  the  public interest;

texts.label: list_item
texts.orig: (h) in appropriate circumstances, order any party to pay the reasonable costs and expenses of another party, including the expenses of witnesses and fees of lawyers, in bringing the matter before the Committee; and
texts.text: (h) in appropriate circumstances, order any party to pay the reasonable costs and expenses of another party, including the expenses of witnesses and fees of lawyers, in bringing the matter before the Committee; and

texts.label: list_item
texts.orig: (i) generally, give directions and do what is necessary or expedient for the hearing and determination of the matter.
texts.text: (i) generally, give directions and do what is necessary or expedient for the hearing and determination of the matter.

texts.orig: General Penalty
texts.text: General Penalty

texts.label: list_item
texts.orig: 44. A person who contravenes or fails to comply with any provision of this Act commits an offence and, where no penalty is expressly provided, shall upon summary conviction be liable to a fine not less than two thousand penalty units and not more than ten thousand penalty units.
texts.text: A person who contravenes or fails to comply with any provision of this Act commits an offence and, where no penalty is expressly provided, shall upon summary conviction be liable to a fine not less than two thousand penalty units and not more than ten thousand penalty units.

texts.orig: (k) procedures for ensuring monitoring of compliance with and the determination of breaches of this Act and the Regulations, including regular .gh domain name space technical audits, and the imposition of sanctions, warnings and other penalties in respect of the breach; and
